--- IdTransformation         : ----------------------------------------------------
--- Factory                  :  
--- Factory                  : Train all methods for Classification ...
--- Factory                  : Train method: BDT for Classification
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : [1mH e l p   f o r   M V A   m e t h o d   [ BDT ] :[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Short description:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Boosted Decision Trees are a collection of individual decision
--- BDT                      : trees which form a multivariate classifier by (weighted) majority 
--- BDT                      : vote of the individual trees. Consecutive decision trees are  
--- BDT                      : trained using the original training data set with re-weighted 
--- BDT                      : events. By default, the AdaBoost method is employed, which gives 
--- BDT                      : events that were misclassified in the previous tree a larger 
--- BDT                      : weight in the training of the following tree.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Decision trees are a sequence of binary splits of the data sample
--- BDT                      : using a single descriminant variable at a time. A test event 
--- BDT                      : ending up after the sequence of left-right splits in a final 
--- BDT                      : ("leaf") node is classified as either signal or background
--- BDT                      : depending on the majority type of training events in that node.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance optimisation:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : By the nature of the binary splits performed on the individual
--- BDT                      : variables, decision trees do not deal well with linear correlations
--- BDT                      : between variables (they need to approximate the linear split in
--- BDT                      : the two dimensional space by a sequence of splits on the two 
--- BDT                      : variables individually). Hence decorrelation could be useful 
--- BDT                      : to optimise the BDT performance.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance tuning via configuration options:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The two most important parameters in the configuration are the  
--- BDT                      : minimal number of events requested by a leaf node as percentage of the 
--- BDT                      :    number of training events (option "MinNodeSize"  replacing the actual number 
--- BDT                      :  of events "nEventsMin" as given in earlier versions
--- BDT                      : If this number is too large, detailed features 
--- BDT                      : in the parameter space are hard to be modelled. If it is too small, 
--- BDT                      : the risk to overtrain rises and boosting seems to be less effective
--- BDT                      :   typical values from our current expericience for best performance  
--- BDT                      :   are between 0.5(%) and 10(%) 
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The default minimal number is currently set to 
--- BDT                      :    max(20, (N_training_events / N_variables^2 / 10)) 
--- BDT                      : and can be changed by the user.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The other crucial parameter, the pruning strength ("PruneStrength"),
--- BDT                      : is also related to overtraining. It is a regularisation parameter 
--- BDT                      : that is used when determining after the training which splits 
--- BDT                      : are considered statistically insignificant and are removed. The
--- BDT                      : user is advised to carefully watch the BDT screen output for
--- BDT                      : the comparison between efficiencies obtained on the training and
--- BDT                      : the independent test sample. They should be equal within statistical
--- BDT                      : errors, in order to minimize statistical fluctuations in different samples.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : <Suppress this message by specifying "!H" in the booking option>
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Begin training
--- BDT                      :  found and suggest the following possible pre-selection cuts 
--- BDT                      : as option DoPreselection was not used, these cuts however will not be performed, but the training will see the full sample
--- BDT                      : <InitEventSample> For classification trees, 
--- BDT                      :  the effective number of backgrounds is scaled to match 
--- BDT                      :  the signal. Othersise the first boosting step would do 'just that'!
--- BDT                      : re-normlise events such that Sig and Bkg have respective sum of weights = 1
--- BDT                      :   sig->sig*1.46501ev. bkg->bkg*1.46501ev.
--- BDT                      : #events: (reweighted) sig: 12499.5 bkg: 12499.5
--- BDT                      : #events: (unweighted) sig: 8532 bkg: 16467
--- BDT                      : Training 300 Decision Trees ... patience please
--- BinaryTree               : The minimal node size MinNodeSize=2 fMinNodeSize=2% is translated to an actual number of events = 251.52 for the training sample size of 12576
--- BinaryTree               : Note: This number will be taken as absolute minimum in the node, 
--- BinaryTree               :       in terms of 'weighted events' and unweighted ones !!

--- IdTransformation         : ----------------------------------------------------
--- Factory                  :  
--- Factory                  : Train all methods for Classification ...
--- Factory                  : Train method: BDT for Classification
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : [1mH e l p   f o r   M V A   m e t h o d   [ BDT ] :[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Short description:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Boosted Decision Trees are a collection of individual decision
--- BDT                      : trees which form a multivariate classifier by (weighted) majority 
--- BDT                      : vote of the individual trees. Consecutive decision trees are  
--- BDT                      : trained using the original training data set with re-weighted 
--- BDT                      : events. By default, the AdaBoost method is employed, which gives 
--- BDT                      : events that were misclassified in the previous tree a larger 
--- BDT                      : weight in the training of the following tree.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Decision trees are a sequence of binary splits of the data sample
--- BDT                      : using a single descriminant variable at a time. A test event 
--- BDT                      : ending up after the sequence of left-right splits in a final 
--- BDT                      : ("leaf") node is classified as either signal or background
--- BDT                      : depending on the majority type of training events in that node.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance optimisation:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : By the nature of the binary splits performed on the individual
--- BDT                      : variables, decision trees do not deal well with linear correlations
--- BDT                      : between variables (they need to approximate the linear split in
--- BDT                      : the two dimensional space by a sequence of splits on the two 
--- BDT                      : variables individually). Hence decorrelation could be useful 
--- BDT                      : to optimise the BDT performance.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance tuning via configuration options:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The two most important parameters in the configuration are the  
--- BDT                      : minimal number of events requested by a leaf node as percentage of the 
--- BDT                      :    number of training events (option "MinNodeSize"  replacing the actual number 
--- BDT                      :  of events "nEventsMin" as given in earlier versions
--- BDT                      : If this number is too large, detailed features 
--- BDT                      : in the parameter space are hard to be modelled. If it is too small, 
--- BDT                      : the risk to overtrain rises and boosting seems to be less effective
--- BDT                      :   typical values from our current expericience for best performance  
--- BDT                      :   are between 0.5(%) and 10(%) 
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The default minimal number is currently set to 
--- BDT                      :    max(20, (N_training_events / N_variables^2 / 10)) 
--- BDT                      : and can be changed by the user.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The other crucial parameter, the pruning strength ("PruneStrength"),
--- BDT                      : is also related to overtraining. It is a regularisation parameter 
--- BDT                      : that is used when determining after the training which splits 
--- BDT                      : are considered statistically insignificant and are removed. The
--- BDT                      : user is advised to carefully watch the BDT screen output for
--- BDT                      : the comparison between efficiencies obtained on the training and
--- BDT                      : the independent test sample. They should be equal within statistical
--- BDT                      : errors, in order to minimize statistical fluctuations in different samples.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : <Suppress this message by specifying "!H" in the booking option>
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Begin training
--- BDT                      :  found and suggest the following possible pre-selection cuts 
--- BDT                      : as option DoPreselection was not used, these cuts however will not be performed, but the training will see the full sample
--- BDT                      : <InitEventSample> For classification trees, 
--- BDT                      :  the effective number of backgrounds is scaled to match 
--- BDT                      :  the signal. Othersise the first boosting step would do 'just that'!
--- BDT                      : re-normlise events such that Sig and Bkg have respective sum of weights = 1
--- BDT                      :   sig->sig*1.46501ev. bkg->bkg*1.46501ev.
--- BDT                      : #events: (reweighted) sig: 12499.5 bkg: 12499.5
--- BDT                      : #events: (unweighted) sig: 8532 bkg: 16467
--- BDT                      : Training 300 Decision Trees ... patience please
--- BinaryTree               : The minimal node size MinNodeSize=2 fMinNodeSize=2% is translated to an actual number of events = 251.52 for the training sample size of 12576
--- BinaryTree               : Note: This number will be taken as absolute minimum in the node, 
--- BinaryTree               :       in terms of 'weighted events' and unweighted ones !!

--- IdTransformation         : ----------------------------------------------------
--- Factory                  :  
--- Factory                  : Train all methods for Classification ...
--- Factory                  : Train method: BDT for Classification
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : [1mH e l p   f o r   M V A   m e t h o d   [ BDT ] :[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Short description:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Boosted Decision Trees are a collection of individual decision
--- BDT                      : trees which form a multivariate classifier by (weighted) majority 
--- BDT                      : vote of the individual trees. Consecutive decision trees are  
--- BDT                      : trained using the original training data set with re-weighted 
--- BDT                      : events. By default, the AdaBoost method is employed, which gives 
--- BDT                      : events that were misclassified in the previous tree a larger 
--- BDT                      : weight in the training of the following tree.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Decision trees are a sequence of binary splits of the data sample
--- BDT                      : using a single descriminant variable at a time. A test event 
--- BDT                      : ending up after the sequence of left-right splits in a final 
--- BDT                      : ("leaf") node is classified as either signal or background
--- BDT                      : depending on the majority type of training events in that node.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance optimisation:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : By the nature of the binary splits performed on the individual
--- BDT                      : variables, decision trees do not deal well with linear correlations
--- BDT                      : between variables (they need to approximate the linear split in
--- BDT                      : the two dimensional space by a sequence of splits on the two 
--- BDT                      : variables individually). Hence decorrelation could be useful 
--- BDT                      : to optimise the BDT performance.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance tuning via configuration options:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The two most important parameters in the configuration are the  
--- BDT                      : minimal number of events requested by a leaf node as percentage of the 
--- BDT                      :    number of training events (option "MinNodeSize"  replacing the actual number 
--- BDT                      :  of events "nEventsMin" as given in earlier versions
--- BDT                      : If this number is too large, detailed features 
--- BDT                      : in the parameter space are hard to be modelled. If it is too small, 
--- BDT                      : the risk to overtrain rises and boosting seems to be less effective
--- BDT                      :   typical values from our current expericience for best performance  
--- BDT                      :   are between 0.5(%) and 10(%) 
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The default minimal number is currently set to 
--- BDT                      :    max(20, (N_training_events / N_variables^2 / 10)) 
--- BDT                      : and can be changed by the user.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The other crucial parameter, the pruning strength ("PruneStrength"),
--- BDT                      : is also related to overtraining. It is a regularisation parameter 
--- BDT                      : that is used when determining after the training which splits 
--- BDT                      : are considered statistically insignificant and are removed. The
--- BDT                      : user is advised to carefully watch the BDT screen output for
--- BDT                      : the comparison between efficiencies obtained on the training and
--- BDT                      : the independent test sample. They should be equal within statistical
--- BDT                      : errors, in order to minimize statistical fluctuations in different samples.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : <Suppress this message by specifying "!H" in the booking option>
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Begin training
--- BDT                      :  found and suggest the following possible pre-selection cuts 
--- BDT                      : as option DoPreselection was not used, these cuts however will not be performed, but the training will see the full sample
--- BDT                      : <InitEventSample> For classification trees, 
--- BDT                      :  the effective number of backgrounds is scaled to match 
--- BDT                      :  the signal. Othersise the first boosting step would do 'just that'!
--- BDT                      : re-normlise events such that Sig and Bkg have respective sum of weights = 1
--- BDT                      :   sig->sig*1.46501ev. bkg->bkg*1.46501ev.
--- BDT                      : #events: (reweighted) sig: 12499.5 bkg: 12499.5
--- BDT                      : #events: (unweighted) sig: 8532 bkg: 16467
--- BDT                      : Training 300 Decision Trees ... patience please
--- BinaryTree               : The minimal node size MinNodeSize=2 fMinNodeSize=2% is translated to an actual number of events = 251.52 for the training sample size of 12576
--- BinaryTree               : Note: This number will be taken as absolute minimum in the node, 
--- BinaryTree               :       in terms of 'weighted events' and unweighted ones !!

--- IdTransformation         : ----------------------------------------------------
--- Factory                  :  
--- Factory                  : Train all methods for Classification ...
--- Factory                  : Train method: BDT for Classification
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : [1mH e l p   f o r   M V A   m e t h o d   [ BDT ] :[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Short description:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Boosted Decision Trees are a collection of individual decision
--- BDT                      : trees which form a multivariate classifier by (weighted) majority 
--- BDT                      : vote of the individual trees. Consecutive decision trees are  
--- BDT                      : trained using the original training data set with re-weighted 
--- BDT                      : events. By default, the AdaBoost method is employed, which gives 
--- BDT                      : events that were misclassified in the previous tree a larger 
--- BDT                      : weight in the training of the following tree.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Decision trees are a sequence of binary splits of the data sample
--- BDT                      : using a single descriminant variable at a time. A test event 
--- BDT                      : ending up after the sequence of left-right splits in a final 
--- BDT                      : ("leaf") node is classified as either signal or background
--- BDT                      : depending on the majority type of training events in that node.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance optimisation:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : By the nature of the binary splits performed on the individual
--- BDT                      : variables, decision trees do not deal well with linear correlations
--- BDT                      : between variables (they need to approximate the linear split in
--- BDT                      : the two dimensional space by a sequence of splits on the two 
--- BDT                      : variables individually). Hence decorrelation could be useful 
--- BDT                      : to optimise the BDT performance.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance tuning via configuration options:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The two most important parameters in the configuration are the  
--- BDT                      : minimal number of events requested by a leaf node as percentage of the 
--- BDT                      :    number of training events (option "MinNodeSize"  replacing the actual number 
--- BDT                      :  of events "nEventsMin" as given in earlier versions
--- BDT                      : If this number is too large, detailed features 
--- BDT                      : in the parameter space are hard to be modelled. If it is too small, 
--- BDT                      : the risk to overtrain rises and boosting seems to be less effective
--- BDT                      :   typical values from our current expericience for best performance  
--- BDT                      :   are between 0.5(%) and 10(%) 
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The default minimal number is currently set to 
--- BDT                      :    max(20, (N_training_events / N_variables^2 / 10)) 
--- BDT                      : and can be changed by the user.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The other crucial parameter, the pruning strength ("PruneStrength"),
--- BDT                      : is also related to overtraining. It is a regularisation parameter 
--- BDT                      : that is used when determining after the training which splits 
--- BDT                      : are considered statistically insignificant and are removed. The
--- BDT                      : user is advised to carefully watch the BDT screen output for
--- BDT                      : the comparison between efficiencies obtained on the training and
--- BDT                      : the independent test sample. They should be equal within statistical
--- BDT                      : errors, in order to minimize statistical fluctuations in different samples.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : <Suppress this message by specifying "!H" in the booking option>
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Begin training
--- BDT                      :  found and suggest the following possible pre-selection cuts 
--- BDT                      : as option DoPreselection was not used, these cuts however will not be performed, but the training will see the full sample
--- BDT                      : <InitEventSample> For classification trees, 
--- BDT                      :  the effective number of backgrounds is scaled to match 
--- BDT                      :  the signal. Othersise the first boosting step would do 'just that'!
--- BDT                      : re-normlise events such that Sig and Bkg have respective sum of weights = 1
--- BDT                      :   sig->sig*1.46501ev. bkg->bkg*1.46501ev.
--- BDT                      : #events: (reweighted) sig: 12499.5 bkg: 12499.5
--- BDT                      : #events: (unweighted) sig: 8532 bkg: 16467
--- BDT                      : Training 300 Decision Trees ... patience please
--- BinaryTree               : The minimal node size MinNodeSize=2 fMinNodeSize=2% is translated to an actual number of events = 251.52 for the training sample size of 12576
--- BinaryTree               : Note: This number will be taken as absolute minimum in the node, 
--- BinaryTree               :       in terms of 'weighted events' and unweighted ones !!

--- IdTransformation         : ----------------------------------------------------
--- Factory                  :  
--- Factory                  : Train all methods for Classification ...
--- Factory                  : Train method: BDT for Classification
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : [1mH e l p   f o r   M V A   m e t h o d   [ BDT ] :[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Short description:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Boosted Decision Trees are a collection of individual decision
--- BDT                      : trees which form a multivariate classifier by (weighted) majority 
--- BDT                      : vote of the individual trees. Consecutive decision trees are  
--- BDT                      : trained using the original training data set with re-weighted 
--- BDT                      : events. By default, the AdaBoost method is employed, which gives 
--- BDT                      : events that were misclassified in the previous tree a larger 
--- BDT                      : weight in the training of the following tree.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Decision trees are a sequence of binary splits of the data sample
--- BDT                      : using a single descriminant variable at a time. A test event 
--- BDT                      : ending up after the sequence of left-right splits in a final 
--- BDT                      : ("leaf") node is classified as either signal or background
--- BDT                      : depending on the majority type of training events in that node.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance optimisation:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : By the nature of the binary splits performed on the individual
--- BDT                      : variables, decision trees do not deal well with linear correlations
--- BDT                      : between variables (they need to approximate the linear split in
--- BDT                      : the two dimensional space by a sequence of splits on the two 
--- BDT                      : variables individually). Hence decorrelation could be useful 
--- BDT                      : to optimise the BDT performance.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance tuning via configuration options:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The two most important parameters in the configuration are the  
--- BDT                      : minimal number of events requested by a leaf node as percentage of the 
--- BDT                      :    number of training events (option "MinNodeSize"  replacing the actual number 
--- BDT                      :  of events "nEventsMin" as given in earlier versions
--- BDT                      : If this number is too large, detailed features 
--- BDT                      : in the parameter space are hard to be modelled. If it is too small, 
--- BDT                      : the risk to overtrain rises and boosting seems to be less effective
--- BDT                      :   typical values from our current expericience for best performance  
--- BDT                      :   are between 0.5(%) and 10(%) 
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The default minimal number is currently set to 
--- BDT                      :    max(20, (N_training_events / N_variables^2 / 10)) 
--- BDT                      : and can be changed by the user.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The other crucial parameter, the pruning strength ("PruneStrength"),
--- BDT                      : is also related to overtraining. It is a regularisation parameter 
--- BDT                      : that is used when determining after the training which splits 
--- BDT                      : are considered statistically insignificant and are removed. The
--- BDT                      : user is advised to carefully watch the BDT screen output for
--- BDT                      : the comparison between efficiencies obtained on the training and
--- BDT                      : the independent test sample. They should be equal within statistical
--- BDT                      : errors, in order to minimize statistical fluctuations in different samples.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : <Suppress this message by specifying "!H" in the booking option>
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Begin training
--- BDT                      :  found and suggest the following possible pre-selection cuts 
--- BDT                      : as option DoPreselection was not used, these cuts however will not be performed, but the training will see the full sample
--- BDT                      : <InitEventSample> For classification trees, 
--- BDT                      :  the effective number of backgrounds is scaled to match 
--- BDT                      :  the signal. Othersise the first boosting step would do 'just that'!
--- BDT                      : re-normlise events such that Sig and Bkg have respective sum of weights = 1
--- BDT                      :   sig->sig*1.46501ev. bkg->bkg*1.46501ev.
--- BDT                      : #events: (reweighted) sig: 12499.5 bkg: 12499.5
--- BDT                      : #events: (unweighted) sig: 8532 bkg: 16467
--- BDT                      : Training 300 Decision Trees ... patience please
--- BinaryTree               : The minimal node size MinNodeSize=2 fMinNodeSize=2% is translated to an actual number of events = 251.52 for the training sample size of 12576
--- BinaryTree               : Note: This number will be taken as absolute minimum in the node, 
--- BinaryTree               :       in terms of 'weighted events' and unweighted ones !!

--- IdTransformation         : ----------------------------------------------------
--- Factory                  :  
--- Factory                  : Train all methods for Classification ...
--- Factory                  : Train method: BDT for Classification
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : [1mH e l p   f o r   M V A   m e t h o d   [ BDT ] :[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Short description:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Boosted Decision Trees are a collection of individual decision
--- BDT                      : trees which form a multivariate classifier by (weighted) majority 
--- BDT                      : vote of the individual trees. Consecutive decision trees are  
--- BDT                      : trained using the original training data set with re-weighted 
--- BDT                      : events. By default, the AdaBoost method is employed, which gives 
--- BDT                      : events that were misclassified in the previous tree a larger 
--- BDT                      : weight in the training of the following tree.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Decision trees are a sequence of binary splits of the data sample
--- BDT                      : using a single descriminant variable at a time. A test event 
--- BDT                      : ending up after the sequence of left-right splits in a final 
--- BDT                      : ("leaf") node is classified as either signal or background
--- BDT                      : depending on the majority type of training events in that node.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance optimisation:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : By the nature of the binary splits performed on the individual
--- BDT                      : variables, decision trees do not deal well with linear correlations
--- BDT                      : between variables (they need to approximate the linear split in
--- BDT                      : the two dimensional space by a sequence of splits on the two 
--- BDT                      : variables individually). Hence decorrelation could be useful 
--- BDT                      : to optimise the BDT performance.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance tuning via configuration options:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The two most important parameters in the configuration are the  
--- BDT                      : minimal number of events requested by a leaf node as percentage of the 
--- BDT                      :    number of training events (option "MinNodeSize"  replacing the actual number 
--- BDT                      :  of events "nEventsMin" as given in earlier versions
--- BDT                      : If this number is too large, detailed features 
--- BDT                      : in the parameter space are hard to be modelled. If it is too small, 
--- BDT                      : the risk to overtrain rises and boosting seems to be less effective
--- BDT                      :   typical values from our current expericience for best performance  
--- BDT                      :   are between 0.5(%) and 10(%) 
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The default minimal number is currently set to 
--- BDT                      :    max(20, (N_training_events / N_variables^2 / 10)) 
--- BDT                      : and can be changed by the user.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The other crucial parameter, the pruning strength ("PruneStrength"),
--- BDT                      : is also related to overtraining. It is a regularisation parameter 
--- BDT                      : that is used when determining after the training which splits 
--- BDT                      : are considered statistically insignificant and are removed. The
--- BDT                      : user is advised to carefully watch the BDT screen output for
--- BDT                      : the comparison between efficiencies obtained on the training and
--- BDT                      : the independent test sample. They should be equal within statistical
--- BDT                      : errors, in order to minimize statistical fluctuations in different samples.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : <Suppress this message by specifying "!H" in the booking option>
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Begin training
--- BDT                      :  found and suggest the following possible pre-selection cuts 
--- BDT                      : as option DoPreselection was not used, these cuts however will not be performed, but the training will see the full sample
--- BDT                      : <InitEventSample> For classification trees, 
--- BDT                      :  the effective number of backgrounds is scaled to match 
--- BDT                      :  the signal. Othersise the first boosting step would do 'just that'!
--- BDT                      : re-normlise events such that Sig and Bkg have respective sum of weights = 1
--- BDT                      :   sig->sig*1.46501ev. bkg->bkg*1.46501ev.
--- BDT                      : #events: (reweighted) sig: 12499.5 bkg: 12499.5
--- BDT                      : #events: (unweighted) sig: 8532 bkg: 16467
--- BDT                      : Training 300 Decision Trees ... patience please
--- BinaryTree               : The minimal node size MinNodeSize=2 fMinNodeSize=2% is translated to an actual number of events = 251.52 for the training sample size of 12576
--- BinaryTree               : Note: This number will be taken as absolute minimum in the node, 
--- BinaryTree               :       in terms of 'weighted events' and unweighted ones !!

--- IdTransformation         : ----------------------------------------------------
--- Factory                  :  
--- Factory                  : Train all methods for Classification ...
--- Factory                  : Train method: BDT for Classification
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : [1mH e l p   f o r   M V A   m e t h o d   [ BDT ] :[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Short description:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Boosted Decision Trees are a collection of individual decision
--- BDT                      : trees which form a multivariate classifier by (weighted) majority 
--- BDT                      : vote of the individual trees. Consecutive decision trees are  
--- BDT                      : trained using the original training data set with re-weighted 
--- BDT                      : events. By default, the AdaBoost method is employed, which gives 
--- BDT                      : events that were misclassified in the previous tree a larger 
--- BDT                      : weight in the training of the following tree.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Decision trees are a sequence of binary splits of the data sample
--- BDT                      : using a single descriminant variable at a time. A test event 
--- BDT                      : ending up after the sequence of left-right splits in a final 
--- BDT                      : ("leaf") node is classified as either signal or background
--- BDT                      : depending on the majority type of training events in that node.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance optimisation:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : By the nature of the binary splits performed on the individual
--- BDT                      : variables, decision trees do not deal well with linear correlations
--- BDT                      : between variables (they need to approximate the linear split in
--- BDT                      : the two dimensional space by a sequence of splits on the two 
--- BDT                      : variables individually). Hence decorrelation could be useful 
--- BDT                      : to optimise the BDT performance.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance tuning via configuration options:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The two most important parameters in the configuration are the  
--- BDT                      : minimal number of events requested by a leaf node as percentage of the 
--- BDT                      :    number of training events (option "MinNodeSize"  replacing the actual number 
--- BDT                      :  of events "nEventsMin" as given in earlier versions
--- BDT                      : If this number is too large, detailed features 
--- BDT                      : in the parameter space are hard to be modelled. If it is too small, 
--- BDT                      : the risk to overtrain rises and boosting seems to be less effective
--- BDT                      :   typical values from our current expericience for best performance  
--- BDT                      :   are between 0.5(%) and 10(%) 
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The default minimal number is currently set to 
--- BDT                      :    max(20, (N_training_events / N_variables^2 / 10)) 
--- BDT                      : and can be changed by the user.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The other crucial parameter, the pruning strength ("PruneStrength"),
--- BDT                      : is also related to overtraining. It is a regularisation parameter 
--- BDT                      : that is used when determining after the training which splits 
--- BDT                      : are considered statistically insignificant and are removed. The
--- BDT                      : user is advised to carefully watch the BDT screen output for
--- BDT                      : the comparison between efficiencies obtained on the training and
--- BDT                      : the independent test sample. They should be equal within statistical
--- BDT                      : errors, in order to minimize statistical fluctuations in different samples.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : <Suppress this message by specifying "!H" in the booking option>
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Begin training
--- BDT                      :  found and suggest the following possible pre-selection cuts 
--- BDT                      : as option DoPreselection was not used, these cuts however will not be performed, but the training will see the full sample
--- BDT                      : <InitEventSample> For classification trees, 
--- BDT                      :  the effective number of backgrounds is scaled to match 
--- BDT                      :  the signal. Othersise the first boosting step would do 'just that'!
--- BDT                      : re-normlise events such that Sig and Bkg have respective sum of weights = 1
--- BDT                      :   sig->sig*1.46501ev. bkg->bkg*1.46501ev.
--- BDT                      : #events: (reweighted) sig: 12499.5 bkg: 12499.5
--- BDT                      : #events: (unweighted) sig: 8532 bkg: 16467
--- BDT                      : Training 300 Decision Trees ... patience please
--- BinaryTree               : The minimal node size MinNodeSize=2 fMinNodeSize=2% is translated to an actual number of events = 251.52 for the training sample size of 12576
--- BinaryTree               : Note: This number will be taken as absolute minimum in the node, 
--- BinaryTree               :       in terms of 'weighted events' and unweighted ones !!

--- IdTransformation         : ----------------------------------------------------
--- Factory                  :  
--- Factory                  : Train all methods for Classification ...
--- Factory                  : Train method: BDT for Classification
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : [1mH e l p   f o r   M V A   m e t h o d   [ BDT ] :[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Short description:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Boosted Decision Trees are a collection of individual decision
--- BDT                      : trees which form a multivariate classifier by (weighted) majority 
--- BDT                      : vote of the individual trees. Consecutive decision trees are  
--- BDT                      : trained using the original training data set with re-weighted 
--- BDT                      : events. By default, the AdaBoost method is employed, which gives 
--- BDT                      : events that were misclassified in the previous tree a larger 
--- BDT                      : weight in the training of the following tree.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Decision trees are a sequence of binary splits of the data sample
--- BDT                      : using a single descriminant variable at a time. A test event 
--- BDT                      : ending up after the sequence of left-right splits in a final 
--- BDT                      : ("leaf") node is classified as either signal or background
--- BDT                      : depending on the majority type of training events in that node.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance optimisation:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : By the nature of the binary splits performed on the individual
--- BDT                      : variables, decision trees do not deal well with linear correlations
--- BDT                      : between variables (they need to approximate the linear split in
--- BDT                      : the two dimensional space by a sequence of splits on the two 
--- BDT                      : variables individually). Hence decorrelation could be useful 
--- BDT                      : to optimise the BDT performance.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : [1m--- Performance tuning via configuration options:[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The two most important parameters in the configuration are the  
--- BDT                      : minimal number of events requested by a leaf node as percentage of the 
--- BDT                      :    number of training events (option "MinNodeSize"  replacing the actual number 
--- BDT                      :  of events "nEventsMin" as given in earlier versions
--- BDT                      : If this number is too large, detailed features 
--- BDT                      : in the parameter space are hard to be modelled. If it is too small, 
--- BDT                      : the risk to overtrain rises and boosting seems to be less effective
--- BDT                      :   typical values from our current expericience for best performance  
--- BDT                      :   are between 0.5(%) and 10(%) 
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The default minimal number is currently set to 
--- BDT                      :    max(20, (N_training_events / N_variables^2 / 10)) 
--- BDT                      : and can be changed by the user.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : The other crucial parameter, the pruning strength ("PruneStrength"),
--- BDT                      : is also related to overtraining. It is a regularisation parameter 
--- BDT                      : that is used when determining after the training which splits 
--- BDT                      : are considered statistically insignificant and are removed. The
--- BDT                      : user is advised to carefully watch the BDT screen output for
--- BDT                      : the comparison between efficiencies obtained on the training and
--- BDT                      : the independent test sample. They should be equal within statistical
--- BDT                      : errors, in order to minimize statistical fluctuations in different samples.
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : <Suppress this message by specifying "!H" in the booking option>
--- BDT                      : [1m================================================================[0m
--- BDT                      : 
--- BDT                      : Begin training
--- BDT                      :  found and suggest the following possible pre-selection cuts 
--- BDT                      : as option DoPreselection was not used, these cuts however will not be performed, but the training will see the full sample
--- BDT                      : <InitEventSample> For classification trees, 
--- BDT                      :  the effective number of backgrounds is scaled to match 
--- BDT                      :  the signal. Othersise the first boosting step would do 'just that'!
--- BDT                      : re-normlise events such that Sig and Bkg have respective sum of weights = 1
--- BDT                      :   sig->sig*1.46501ev. bkg->bkg*1.46501ev.
--- BDT                      : #events: (reweighted) sig: 12499.5 bkg: 12499.5
--- BDT                      : #events: (unweighted) sig: 8532 bkg: 16467
--- BDT                      : Training 300 Decision Trees ... patience please
--- BinaryTree               : The minimal node size MinNodeSize=2 fMinNodeSize=2% is translated to an actual number of events = 251.52 for the training sample size of 12576
--- BinaryTree               : Note: This number will be taken as absolute minimum in the node, 
--- BinaryTree               :       in terms of 'weighted events' and unweighted ones !!
